title: Improve `ComposableController` typing for child controllers and allow lists
body:
## Explanation

Each `ComposableController` instance requires its own controller-messenger and allow list typing that is specific to the set of child controllers that are being composed.

This is new behavior that can't extend from the `BaseController`, as controller-messenger allow lists are generally defined for the controller class singleton, not controller instances.

To implement this, `ComposableController` and `ComposableControllerMessenger` need to be made polymorphic upon the `controllers` constructor property (list of child controllers to be composed). A starting point would be adding a generic parameter `ControllerList` to the `ComposableController` class:

- `ControllerList` should be constrained, but not defined by the `ControllerInstance` type.
- `ControllerList` should be used to define the return type of `flatState()` at the type level.
- `ControllerList` should be used to derive the allow lists of `ComposableControllerMessenger`. 
  - The allow lists should at minimum include the `stateChange` events for child controllers that are used in the `#updateChildController()` method. 

## References

- See https://github.com/MetaMask/core/issues/2082
